MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: After an hour's walk from the base of operations in the town, we were able to reach our destination, a small sanatorium, while avoiding the mist that had formed along the way.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I'm sorry to bother you so late at night.
We've brought your medicine and food!
The people in the sanatorium had spent sleepless nights due to the fear of the mist monsters that roamed the area, not to mention the lack of supplies.
Oculus distributed the medicines according to the list she held in her hand.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It's very important not to make a mistake with this kind of thing. I got this list from the doctor in town. Ah, sorry! That's the wrong medicine! That's not stomach medicine, it's for athlete's foot!
Oculus handed out the food we had brought and informed the people of the sanatorium of the SSS's activities, including the mission to destroy the mist monsters in the area starting at dawn.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Ta-da! That's where I come in! I tore up the monsties, picked through their remains, and tore them up even more! I brought peace to the town in no time at all.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
And it's all thanks to the conductor, the commander of the SSS!
Let's give it up for the conductor! Whoo!
The cheers and applause poured in. I felt a little awkward because I wasn't used to this kind of thing. Oculus put her hand over her mouth as if in a panic.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Oh no, I forgot our being here was top secret. Ah! Pretend you didn't hear any of that. We weren't supposed to be here tonight!
Everyone nodded gently at the flustered Oculus. They probably wouldn't tell anyone about tonight, and if they did, I'm sure it'd be OK.
If the existence of the SSS becomes known, the people who are suffering due to the phantom mist may be able to feel a sense of hope.

Tonight, Oculus delivered more than just supplies to this sanatorium.
She brought hope and security.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Alright, I guess that's it. Thanks to the conductor coming with me, we were able to bring you plenty of medicine and food. I hope you all get well soon. Take care.
With that, we left the sanatorium.

Now we just need to get back to the inn.
We should be back before dawn, as planned.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Hey, can we make a quick detour?
It won't take up too much time.
That's fine, but where are you planning to go? I don't think there was any place go between the town and the sanatorium.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Yeah, there is.
Come on, this way.

Upon saying that, Oculus proceeded to take a different path from the one we used to come this way.
This path leads to where the phantom mist was...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
That's right.
What? Did you think I got scared and decided to just run away?
No, I thought you were prioritizing delivering the supplies.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
You're half right. I'm worried that the medicine bottles might break,
so I wouldn't have been able to put my all into the fight.

That's one of the reasons you took the roundabout way.
What's the other reason?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I'm the type of person who saves her favorite food for last.

Phantom mist began to fill the area. Oculus seemed to be enjoying herself.
As we continued on our way, a mist monster appeared.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Hey, misty! Prepare yourselves! You guys made me stay up late, y'know?
And I've been really worried about my skin lately!
I thought you said that you're fighting the mist monsters so that we can create a peaceful world where people can always get what they need and go where they want to go.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Oh, you don't understand at all. It's important to take care of your skin on a daily basis. It's too late if you wait until you've started aging. So if I don't take care of my skin first, I won't be able to fight for the whole world.

Whether it understood what we were saying or not, the mist monster that she had yelled at bared its fangs. At the same time, Oculus unleashed a burst of attack magic, destroying the enemy in an instant.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Yeah! That was awesome!
And it was only the beginning.

Only the beginning?
You're not seriously going to continue eradicating the mist monsters?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Sorry, conductor. I guess I'm getting a little carried away. I can't seem to help myself. Since it's just the two of us tonight, would you mind spending a little more time with me?

Oculus' eyes blazed as they reflected the blue light of the moon. I tried to tell her this was a bad idea, but she didn't seem to listen. When Oculus said we were going to take a detour, I knew this kind of thing was going to happen, so I'd prepared myself for it.
All right, but only until morning, OK?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
That's why I love you! Don't worry. I'm sure I'll be done by morning.
Now, onto the next one!
Raising her staff, Oculus began to walk briskly. As I looked at the back of her head, I thought that perhaps Oculus alone would be able to annihilate all the monsters.
Because she never gives up. And so long as we don't give up, anything can come true. It seems like tomorrow's mission to clean up the remaining monsters might be canceled.
